Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Petunia hybrida defensin 1 (PhD1; Cys-rich; Plant defensin)
Sequence Information.Target Organism: Fungi:Fusarium oxysporum (MIC=10 µg/ml), Botrytis cinerea (MIC=10 µg/ml).
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: No hemolysis information or data found in the reference(s) presented in this entry
Sequence Information.Cytotoxicity: No cytotoxicity information found in the reference(s) presented
Sequence Information.Nonterminal Modifications and Unusual Am: When compared to other plant defensins, the petunia defensins have an additional fifth disulfide bond. There are five disulfide bonds between Cys3 and Cys47, Cys7 and Cys23, Cys14 and Cys34, Cys20 and Cys41, Cys24 and Cys43.
Sequence Information.Structure Description: PhD1 has the fold of the cysteine-stabilized alphabeta motif, consisting of an alpha-helix and a triple-stranded antiparallel beta-sheet, except that it contains a fifth disulfide bond from the first loop to the alpha-helix.
Sequence Information.Predicted Structure: There is no predicted structure for DRAMP00454.
Sequence Information.Function: Plant defense peptide with antifungal activity.
Sequence Information.Domain: The presence of a 'disulfide through disulfide knot' structurally defines this protein as a knottin.
Sequence Information.Biophysicochemical properties: pH dependence (Stable under extremes of pH); Temperature dependence (Stable under extremes of temperature).

Literature.Title: Isolation and properties of floral defensins from ornamental tobacco and petunia.
Literature.Author: Lay FT, Brugliera F, Anderson MA.

Literature.Title: Structure of Petunia hybrida defensin 1, a novel plant defensin with five disulfide bonds.
Literature.Author: Janssen BJ, Schirra HJ, Lay FT, Anderson MA, Craik DJ.
